name: CLEAN ENERGY GROUP STRATEGY/MJB&A COALITIONS
description: Power plant and public utilities, coalitions include CAPI, CPPI, MJB&A & Water Initiatives
sampleDescriptions: EPA rulemakings, current and proposed, that affect the electric sector including: EPAs Clean Water Rule and related rulemakings (Definition of Waters of the United States - Addition of an Applicability Date to 2015 Clean Water Rule; Definition of Waters of the United States - Recodification of Preexisting Rule); Migratory Bird Treaty Act; Bald Eagle rulemakings; Clean Power Plan Repeal; State Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Update to Regulations for Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act

Revisions to New Source Review Program; The Safe Affordable Fuel-Efficient (SAFE) Vehicles Rule for Model Years 2021-2026 Passenger Cars and Light Trucks; NESHAP for Coal and Oil Fired EGUs; Reconsideration of Supplemental Funding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources; Electric Utility Generating Units; climate, resilience, and clean energy and transportation infrastructure legislative proposals; and HR 1768, S 747, Diesel Reduction Act of 2019 and its reauthorization; draft NEPA guidance on consideration of Greenhouse Gas Emmissions.

The Safe Affordable Fuel-Efficient (SAFE) Vehicles Rules for Model Years 2021-2026 Passenger Cars and Light Trucks; NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units--Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of the Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Revisions to Emission Guidelines Implementing Regulations; Draft National Environmental Policy Act Guidance on Consideration of Greenhouse Gas Emissions; climate, resilience, and clean energy and transportation legislative proposals; and HR 1768, S 747 Diesel Reduction Act of 2019 and its reauthorization

The Safe Affordable Fuel-Efficient (SAFE) Vehicles Rules for Model Years 2021-2026 Passenger Cars and Light Trucks; NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units--Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of the Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Revisions to Emission Guidelines Implementing Regulations; Draft National Environmental Policy Act Guidance on Consideration of Greenhouse Gas Emissions; Revised Definition of "Waters of the United States" (Step 2); and climate, resilience, and clean energy and transportation legislative proposals including response to the House Select Committee on the Climate Crisis request for information.

The Safe Affordable Fuel-Efficient (SAFE) Vehicles Rules for Model Years 2021-2026 Passenger Cars and Light Trucks Part Two; NESHAP: Coal-and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units--Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of the Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions Prom Existing Electric Utility Generating Units, Revisions to Emission Guidelines Implementing Regulations; Strengthening Transparency in Regulatory Science rulemaking; Update to the Regulations Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act; Revised Definition of "Waters of the United States" (Step 2); Regulations Governing Take of Migratory Birds;; Energy and Commerce Committee Discussion Draft CLEAN Future Act; House Select Committee on the Climate Crisis policy recommendations; and climate, resilience, and clean energy and transportation legislative proposals.

The Safe Affordable Fuel-Efficient (SAFE) Vehicles Rules for Model Years 2021-2026 Passenger Cars and Light Trucks Part Two; NESHAP: Coal-and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units--Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of the Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Electric Utility Generating Units, Revisions to Emission Guidelines Implementing Regulations; Strengthening Transparency in Regulatory Science rulemaking; Increasing Consistency and Transparency in Considering Benefits and Costs in the Clean Air Act Rulemaking Process; CSAPR Update rulemaking; New Source review rulemakings; Revised Definition of "Waters of the United States" (Step 2); Update to the Regulations Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act; Regulations Governing Take of Migratory Birds; Energy and Commerce Committee Discussion Draft CLEAN Future Act; House Select Committee on the Climate-Solving the Climate Crisis: The Congressional Action Plan for a Clean Energy Economy and a Healthy, Resilient, and Just America; Clean Energy Innovation and Deployment Act; and other climate, resilience, and clean energy and transportation legislative proposals.

Regulations referenced in Executive Order 13990 and Executive Order 14008, including: NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units - Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Oil and Natural Gas Sector: Emission Standards for New, Reconstructed, and Modified Sources Reconsideration; CSAPR Update rulemaking; Update to the Regulations Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act; Regulations Governing Take of Migratory Birds; Energy and Commerce CLEAN Future Act; Clean Energy Innovation and Deployment Act; and other climate, resilience, and clean energy and Transportation legislative proposals.

Regulations referenced in Executive Order 13990 and Executive Order 14008, including: NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units - Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Oil and Natural Gas Sector: Emission Standards for New, Reconstructed, and Modified Sources Reconsideration; CSAPR Update rulemaking; Interstate Transport Rule; Update to the Regulations Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act; Waters of the US Revisions and Rulemaking; Regulations Governing Take of Migratory Birds; Energy and Commerce CLEAN Future Act; Clean Energy Innovation and Deployment Act; Build Back Better Act; and other climate, resilience, and clean energy and Transportation legislative proposals.

Regulations referenced in Executive Order 13990 and Executive Order 14008, including: NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units - Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Review of Standards; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Oil and Natural Gas Sector: Emission Standards for New, Reconstructed, and Modified Sources Reconsideration; CSAPR Update rulemaking; Interstate Transport Rule; Proposed Good Neighbor Plan; Update to the Regulations Implementing the Procedural Provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act; Waters of the US Revisions and Rulemaking; Regulations Governing Take of Migratory Birds; Build Back Better Act; and other climate, resilience, environmental justice, and clean energy and Transportation legislative proposals.

Regulations referenced in Executive Order 13990 and Executive Order 14008 and related regulations, including: NESHAP: Coal- and Oil-Fired Electric Utility Steam Generating Units - Reconsideration of Supplemental Cost Finding and Residual Risk and Technology Review; Proposed Revocation of the 2020 Reconsideration and Affirmation of the Appropriate and Necessary Supplemental Finding; Review of Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Stationary Sources: Electric Utility Generating Units; Repeal of Clean Power Plan; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Existing Electric Utility Generating Units; Oil and Natural Gas Sector: Emission Standards for New, Reconstructed, and Modified Sources Reconsideration; CSAPR Update rulemaking; Interstate Transport Rule; Proposed Good Neighbor Plan; and Regulations for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Passenger Cars and Trucks. Implementation of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, including electric vehicle deployment and hydrogen infrastructure and development. Administration and Congressional activity related to other climate, resilience, environmental justice, and clean energy and transportation legislative proposals.
